Explore Australia’s captivating, vast and remote interior on this once in a lifetime all- inclusive journey. From the north to the south, and east to west, Australia is a land of ever-shifting landscapes, cultures, and faces. While there are countless ways to explore it, there’s only one that offers unmatched ease and comfort: the magic of rail travel. Aboard, you’ll find yourself in a moving theatre of breathtaking views, led by warm, welcoming service. Each moment unfolds like a scene in an unforgettable show—the exquisite dining, cozy cabins, lively lounge car, new friendships, thrilling Off Train Experiences, and the awe of sunrises and sunsets. It’s a journey of epic proportions. View more View less the Ghan rail & sightseeing from $ $6169 per person twin share. Please ask us about discounted Advance Purchase fares on select departures Itinerary Day 1: Darwin to Katherine Your journey begins with a morning departure from Darwin. Once you’re settled into your private cabin, mingle with fellow travellers or sample the exceptional food, wine, and service onboard. When it’s time for lunch, savour the regionally-inspired menu accompanied by a selection of all-inclusive wines and beverages, before an early afternoon arrival at the Top End township of Katherine. Take a relaxing cruise through Nitmiluk Gorge’s ancient natural wonders and exploring the region’s rich Indigenous culture. Enjoy dinner as the sun sets over the outback, then back in your cabin you’ll find your bed turned down. Fall asleep as the train rolls soothingly onwards. Day 2: Alice Springs After your first night on The Ghan, you’ll be greeted by a morning view of the spectacular Red Centre. A full day of excursions awaits you in the outback town of Alice Springs. An optional upgrade is a scenic flight to Uluru, returning in time to meet the rest of your fellow guests at a spectacular barbeque dinner under a million stars at the historic Alice Springs Telegraph Station. Day 3: Manguri and Coober Pedy From your morning stop at the outback outpost of Manguri, you’ll venture into the weird and wonderful opal mining township of Coober Pedy, where more than half of the residents live underground. Here, you’ll enjoy a day of discovery, and a gourmet lunch in the most unique of locations: underground. Dinner is served back on the train where you can enjoy a nightcap as your journey continues.
